titleStmt.title: The schollers purgatory discouered in the Stationers common-wealth, and discribed in a discourse apologeticall, asvvell for the publike aduantage of the Church, the state & vvhole common-vvealth of England, as for the remedy of priuate iniuryes. By Geo: VVither.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A15655 of text S120316 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 25919). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 206 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 71 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The schollers purgatory discouered in the Stationers common-wealth, and discribed in a discourse apologeticall, asvvell for the publike aduantage of the Church, the state & vvhole common-vvealth of England, as for the remedy of priuate iniuryes. By Geo: VVither.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted [by G. Wood] for the honest Stationers,

notesStmt.note: A defense of Wither's patent for his: The hymnes and songs of the Church.
Printer's name and publication date from STC.
Quires A-D are apparently from one type font and E-I from another, with quire (.)̇⁴ possibly printed at the second press (STC).
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
